images.copyright: Temples on Hemakuta Hill, Hampi, Karnataka, India (© Images of india/Alamy)
images.title: Whispers of the past
images.caption: Hemakuta Hill, Hampi, India
images.desc: Hampi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Karnataka, India. The group of monuments—ancient temples, majestic palaces, and intricate ruins—are remnants of the former capital city of the Vijayanagara Empire, which ruled much of South India between the 14th and 16th centuries.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
tooltips.walls: Download this image. Use of this image is restricted to wallpaper only.
